episodes.title: The Gap
episodes.description: Manousos begins a dangerous trek to meet Carol. Returning home from Las Vegas, Carol gets creative with her rebellion.

episodes.title: Charm Offensive
episodes.description: Carol takes a different tack with The Others and discovers more than she anticipated. Manousos awakens in unfamiliar surroundings.

episodes.title: The Cage
episodes.description: Capt. Pike is held prisoner and tested by aliens who have the power to project incredibly lifelike illusions.

episodes.title: The Man Trap
episodes.description: Dr. McCoy discovers his old flame is not what she seems after crew members begin dying from a sudden lack of salt in their bodies.

episodes.title: Charlie X
episodes.description: Captain Kirk must learn the limits to the power of a 17-year-old boy with the psionic ability to create anything and destroy anyone.

episodes.title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
episodes.description: The flight recorder of the 200-year-old U.S.S. Valiant relays a tale of terror--a magnetic storm at the edge of the galaxy.

episodes.title: The Naked Time
episodes.description: The crew is infected with a mysterious disease that removes people's emotional inhibitions to a dangerous degree.

episodes.title: The Enemy Within
episodes.description: A transporter malfunction splits Captain Kirk into two halves: one meek and indecisive, the other violent and ill tempered. The remaining crew members stranded on the planet cannot be beamed up to the ship until a problem is fixed.

episodes.title: Mudd's Women
episodes.description: The Enterprise picks up untrustworthy entrepreneur Harry Mudd accompanied by three beautiful women who immediately put a spell on all the male crew members.

episodes.title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
episodes.description: Nurse Chapel is reunited with her fianc√©; but his new obsession leads him to make an android duplicate of Captain Kirk.

episodes.title: Miri
episodes.description: The Enterprise discovers a planet exactly like Earth, but the only inhabitants are children who contract a fatal disease upon entering puberty.

episodes.title: Dagger of the Mind
episodes.description: Kirk and psychiatrist Helen Noel are trapped on a maximum security penal colony that experiments with mind control and Spock must use the Vulcan mind-meld to find a way to save them.

episodes.title: The Corbomite Maneuver
episodes.description: After the Enterprise is forced to destroy a dangerous marker buoy, a gigantic alien ship arrives to capture and condemn the crew as trespassers.

episodes.title: The Menagerie: Part I
episodes.description: Spock kidnaps the disabled Capt. Pike, hijacks the Enterprise, and then surrenders for court martial.

episodes.title: The Menagerie: Part II
episodes.description: At Spock's court martial, he explains himself with mysterious footage about when Capt. Pike was kidnapped by powerful illusion casting aliens.

episodes.title: The Conscience of the King
episodes.description: While Captain Kirk investigates whether an actor is actually a presumed dead mass murderer, a mysterious assailant is killing the people who could identify the fugitive.

episodes.title: Balance of Terror
episodes.description: The Enterprise must decide on its response when a Romulan ship makes a destructively hostile armed probe of Federation territory.

episodes.title: Shore Leave
episodes.description: The past months have left the crew exhausted and in desperate need of a break, but does this explain McCoy's encounter with a human-sized white rabbit or Kirk crossing paths with the prankster who plagued his days at Starfleet Academy?

episodes.title: The Galileo Seven
episodes.description: The Galileo, under Spock's command, crash-lands on a hostile planet. As the Enterprise races against time to find the shuttlecraft, Spock's strictly logical leadership clashes with the fear and resentment of his crew.

episodes.title: The Squire of Gothos
episodes.description: A being that controls matter and creates planets wants to play with the Enterprise crew.

episodes.title: Arena
episodes.description: For bringing hostility into their solar system, a superior alien race brings Captain Kirk into mortal combat against the reptilian captain of an alien ship he was pursuing.

episodes.title: Tomorrow Is Yesterday
episodes.description: The Enterprise is thrown back in time to 1960s Earth.

episodes.title: Court Martial
episodes.description: Kirk draws a court martial in the negligent death of a crewman.

episodes.title: The Return of the Archons
episodes.description: Seeking the answer to a century-old mystery, Kirk and crew encounter a vacantly peaceful society under a 6000-year autocratic rule that kills all those it can't absorb.

episodes.title: Space Seed
episodes.description: While on patrol in deep space, Captain Kirk and his crew find and revive a genetically-engineered world conqueror and his compatriots from Earth's Twentieth Century.

episodes.title: A Taste of Armageddon
episodes.description: Kirk and Spock must save their ship's crew when they are all declared killed in action in a bizarre computer simulated war where the actual deaths must nevertheless occur.

episodes.title: This Side of Paradise
episodes.description: The Enterprise investigates a planet whose colonists should be dead, but are not.

episodes.title: The Devil in the Dark
episodes.description: The Enterprise is sent to a mining colony that is being terrorized by a mysterious monster, only to find that the situation is not that simple.

episodes.title: Errand of Mercy
episodes.description: With a war with Klingons raging, Kirk and Spock attempt to resist an occupation of a planet with incomprehensibly placid natives.

episodes.title: The Alternative Factor
episodes.description: Existence itself comes under threat from a man's power-struggle with his alternate self, with the Enterprise's strained dilithium crystals presenting his key to a final solution.

episodes.title: The City on the Edge of Forever
episodes.description: When a temporarily insane Dr. McCoy accidentally changes history and destroys his time, Kirk and Spock follow him to prevent the disaster, but the price to do so is high.

episodes.title: Operation -- Annihilate!
episodes.description: The Enterprise crew attempts to stop a plague of amoeba-like creatures from possessing human hosts and spreading throughout the galaxy.

episodes.title: Amok Time
episodes.description: In the throes of his Pon Farr mating period, Spock must return to Vulcan to meet his intended future wife, betrothed from childhood.

episodes.title: The Child
episodes.description: Deanna is impregnated by an unknown alien life-form, and Dr. Katherine Pulaski joins the Enterprise as the ship's new Chief Medical Officer.

episodes.title: Where Silence Has Lease
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a mysterious void in space, and when they move in closer to investigate further, it envelops them and they can't get out.

episodes.title: Elementary, Dear Data
episodes.description: An attempt to provide Data with a challenging Sherlock Holmes holodeck program backfires when its Professor Moriarty character accidentally becomes self-aware.

episodes.title: The Outrageous Okona
episodes.description: The Enterprise rescues the captain of a broken-down freighter, only to become involved in a dispute between feuding worlds, each demanding custody of their guest. Data seeks help from Guinan in understanding humor.

episodes.title: Loud as a Whisper
episodes.description: The crew ferries a deaf mediator to Solais V to negotiate an end to a civil war.

episodes.title: The Schizoid Man
episodes.description: A dying anti-social scientist unintentionally comes upon the perfect vessel in which to preserve his intellect and arrogant personality - Data.

episodes.title: Unnatural Selection
episodes.description: Enhanced DNA developments trigger an epidemic of rapid aging. Caught among its victims - Dr. Pulaski.

episodes.title: A Matter of Honor
episodes.description: Under an Officers Exchange Program, Riker serves aboard a Klingon ship, whose aging captain seeks an unwarranted bloody retaliation for suspected Enterprise treachery.

episodes.title: The Measure of a Man
episodes.description: When Data resigns his commission rather than be dismantled for examination by an inadequately skilled scientist, a formal hearing is convened to determine whether Data is considered property without rights or is a sentient being.

episodes.title: The Dauphin
episodes.description: Wesley falls for the young future leader of Daled IV, unaware just how dangerous the girl's protective and overly restrictive guardian can be.

episodes.title: Contagion
episodes.description: Encountering the superior technology of a very ancient race creates system malfunctions for a doomed Federation starship, for the Enterprise, and for an eavesdropping Romulan warbird.

episodes.title: The Royale
episodes.description: Worf, Data, and Riker find themselves trapped in a re-creation of a poorly written novel.

episodes.title: Time Squared
episodes.description: The Enterprise comes across its own shuttlecraft adrift in space - a duplicate - with an unconscious duplicate Capt. Picard inside.

episodes.title: The Icarus Factor
episodes.description: Riker's delight at being offered a command of the USS Ares turns to frustration when the man sent to prepare him for his mission is his estranged father; Worf's behavior leads Wesley to delve into Klingon tradition.

episodes.title: Pen Pals
episodes.description: Data befriends an alien girl in distress, breaking the Prime Directive, while Wesley commands his first team.

episodes.title: Q Who
episodes.description: Q tries to prove that Picard needs him as part of their crew by hurling the Enterprise 7,000 light years away where they encounter the Borg for the first time.

episodes.title: Samaritan Snare
episodes.description: With Picard away for routine surgery, the Enterprise responds to an apparent distress call from a Pakled vessel.

episodes.title: Up the Long Ladder
episodes.description: An antiquated distress signal leads to two lost 22nd century Earth colonies, each facing doom in different ways, one by fire, the other by prolonged cloning.

episodes.title: Manhunt
episodes.description: A midlife Betazoid condition renders Ambassador Troi hot on the hunt for romance and wedlock with Captain Picard - or any man.

episodes.title: The Emissary
episodes.description: The Enterprise addresses the emergency of an old Klingon ship coming out of stasis and ready to fight the Federation. A half-Human/half Klingon emissary arrives to help, who once knew Worf intimately.

episodes.title: Peak Performance
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise participates in war games.

episodes.title: Shades of Gray
episodes.description: When Commander Riker comes down with a dangerous alien infection after an away mission, the only way to treat it may be through reliving his memories.
